summary:
Implemented all Entity Framework data models and DbContext for Progress Path application:

**Enums created:**
- UserRole (Teacher)
- GoalType (Binary, Percentage)
- AlertType (OffTopic, Inactivity)

**Entity models created:**
- User: Teacher with Google OAuth fields, profile data, and Groups navigation
- Group: Learning group with JoinCode, GoalDescription, GoalType, TotalSteps, GoalInterpretation (JSON), WelcomeMessage, and StudentSessions navigation
- StudentSession: Student session with Nickname, DeviceId, CurrentProgress, OffTopicWarningCount, HasActiveAlert, AlertType, and navigations to ChatMessages/HelpAlerts
- ChatMessage: Chat messages with ContributesToProgress and IsOffTopic flags (per REQ-AI-028)
- HelpAlert: Help alerts with AlertType and resolution tracking

**DbContext configuration:**
- Unique indexes on: User.GoogleId, Group.JoinCode, (StudentSession.GroupId + DeviceId), (StudentSession.GroupId + Nickname)
- Performance indexes on: User.Email, ChatMessage.StudentSessionId, ChatMessage.Timestamp, HelpAlert.StudentSessionId, HelpAlert.IsResolved
- Cascade delete relationships properly configured
- EF Core Design package added for migrations support
- DbContext registered in Program.cs with SQL Server provider

Build verification was not possible due to dotnet SDK not being available in the execution environment.
deviations: Could not verify build with 'dotnet build' command - the dotnet SDK was not accessible in the shell environment. The code follows standard EF Core patterns and should compile correctly when run in an environment with dotnet SDK installed.
